data.title: The Eleventh Hour TV Series (2008)
data.meta_description:
Rufus Sewel, Marley Shelton, Marc Blucas, Michael OKeefe, Kate Nelligan, Colin Lawrence, Damien Leake, Lindsay Pulsipher, Kavita Patil


New CBS sci-fi...

#1

Rufus Sewel, Marley Shelton, Marc Blucas, Michael OKeefe, Kate Nelligan, Colin Lawrence, Damien Leake, Lindsay Pulsipher, Kavita Patil

New CBS sci-fi series based on the UK The Eleventh Hour TV Series with Patrick Steward (2005).

Jacob Hood, a special science adviser to the government who, with his female bodyguard Rachel, saves people from the worst abuses of science.

The pilot episode will be produced with a budget of four million dollars, which is considered unusually large for the development of a television series. Some critics are likening the pilot to The X-Files.

Produced by: Jerry Bruckheimer. The series is a joint venture between Jerry Bruckheimer Television, Granada Television and Warner Bros. Television.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m8N9qZVYkU8

I'm certainly going to give this version a go and I reckon a US version of Bonekickers would be far more entertaining than that travesty I watched, well put up with until switching off in disbelief

plus i dig rufus sewll, i always thought he was a bit underrated...guys a solid actor, and seems right for this role..

#5

Episode 1 - Resurrection

Episode 1 was not bad, directed by Danny Cannon, the main leads Rufus Sewell & Marley Shelton are good together, the plot...spoiler

(about cloning a child for a rich man, who lost his son)

is exactly the same as the UK episode 1 with Patrick Stewart & Ashley Jensen shown in 2006, which was only 4 episodes.

Not sure there is anyone here if you already saw the UK version off the series which was pretty good, i assume they will extend the series longer than the UK version. But i enjoyed the US version nevertheless. 8/10

Last edited: Oct 11, 2008
